intro: Astragalus rubrigalli, commonly known as the red-hairy milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, trifoliate leaves, and small, yellowish-pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Astragalus rubrigalli is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the ecological stability of its native environments.
